27 Aug 2012

A Bunch of Weirdo Hippies at Cedar Lake

By in category

There are at least 18 lakes named Cedar Lake in Ontario so it’s hard to say which one the 70′s folk group “Cedar Lake” was named for.

The folk band included Canadian music luminaries like brothers Stan and Garnet Rogers and a host of other well-known folkies. The band had about 20 members at its peak.

In some ways the band sounds like an old-fashioned version of Broken Social Scene. But the band was more broken than on the scene. They lasted less than a year.

According to an online bio on Garnet Rogers, Rogers told the Boston Globe that the band Cedar Lake consisted of:

“A bunch of complete and utter lunatics, really disgusting, underrehearsed weirdo hippies, most of whom have found well-deserved obscurity.”

Sounds like an awesome band. In fact, I think they need to stage a revival at Casinorama some time soon.
